justification: Offer ignores Team B’s mindset and needs. B is conservative, prefers pocket passers/veterans, and needs wins; trading a Tier 1 QB (Chris Reed) plus a starter WR for a rookie Tier 5 RB is implausible, especially with B’s RB depth. It mislabels Josh Robinson as “elite” and claims A has RB depth despite injuries. Rationale is A-centric, doesn’t address B’s incentives (injured buy-lows, possession WRs), and conflicts with A’s own preference for workhorse RB stability and stacks.
